thread.title: Pavlyuchenkova ousts 2nd-seeded Safarova at Kremlin Cup
thread.title_full: Pavlyuchenkova ousts 2nd-seeded Safarova at Kremlin Cup

title: Pavlyuchenkova ousts 2nd-seeded Safarova at Kremlin Cup
text:
Russia's Pavlyuchenkova ousts No. 2-seeded Safarova in 2nd round of Kremlin Cup THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   7:43   7:43   
People: 
Eastern Europe (362) 

MOSCOW — Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova of Russia ousted second-seeded Lucie Safarova from the Kremlin Cup 6-1, 6-7 (2), 6-3 on Wednesday, reducing the Czech player's chances of making the season-ending WTA finals. 
Safarova's second-round loss guaranteed a spot in Singapore for Germany's Angelique Kerber. The last two spots were still up for grabs, and U.S. Open champion Flavia Pennetta also was in Moscow in hope of securing one of them. She was playing her first match later Wednesday. 
After easily taking the first set, Pavlyuchenkova, last year's Kremlin Cup winner, failed to convert her only match point in the second with Safarova serving at 6-5. She then double-faulted on her opponent's first set point in the tiebreaker. 
Reclaiming control in the decider, the Russian got the win when Safarova hit a volley long.
